objdescid.compdate: c. 1780-85The monochrome wash drawing on the verso, *St. John the Evangelist Before a Vision of Christ*, dates from c. 1782.

provenance.note: Early history not known; acquired at a unknown time by John Deffett Francis; given by Francis to the British Museum in Dec. 1874.

objnote.p: Blake developed this subject and basic composition through a series of eight further drawings, including Butlin 120A recto and verso, 121, 122 recto and verso, 123 recto, 124, and possibly untraced 125, *Christ as the Good Shepherd*.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The general theme and subject of this composition were probably influenced by several biblical passages, including Ruth 2:1-17, I Samuel 12:16-19, and Matthew 9:38. Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. Three male figures stand or walk in the center of the composition facing right. The rightmost of these is visible only from the waist up and raises clasped hands in what may be a gesture of prayer. The central figure, also only visible from the waist up, bends his right arm and extends his left, with fingers spread. The leftmost figure of this trio, who is gowned, extends his left leg backward and raises both arms at approximately 45 degrees, palms facing up. He turns his head to the left to look down at the group of three figures in the lower left corner of the scene. This may be Christ. Three(?) small figures are positioned above this group, apparently in the distance. In the lower right corner of the composition, two gowned female figures walk left. The rightmost figure may carry something in her arms, possibly a bundle of grain, and her companion extends her left leg backward and points down at the ground with her left hand. Above these figures in the distance is another figure, possibly with arms raised vertically. Three figures stand, squatting slightly, lower left. The figure furthest left in this group raised his(?) arms horizontally, hands together. The figure on the right in this group extends his bent left arm and hand upward, fingers spread. Above is the head and upper body of a figure, apparently with his(?) left arm bent over his chest and possibly carrying a large object (a sack of wheat?) on his back. Multiple structures, perhaps a barn or house at left and a silo at right, stand in the upper left corner of the scene. Vertical lines in the foreground likely indicate the agricultural crop and background horizontal lines suggest additional fields.

component.illusobjdesc: Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. Three male figures stand or walk in the center of the composition facing right. The rightmost of these is visible only from the waist up and raises clasped hands in what may be a gesture of prayer. He has short hair and the curved line beneath his right arm suggests he may have a long beard.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. Three male figures stand or walk in the center of the composition facing right. The bearded central figure may have short hair. He is visible only from the waist up; he bends his right arm and extends his left, with fingers spread. He may points right with his right hand, his bent right arm extended across his chest.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. Three male figures stand or walk in the center of the composition facing right. The leftmost figure of this trio has short hair and wears a gown. Walking, he extends his left leg backwards and raises both arms at approximately 45 degrees, palms facing up. He turns his head to the left to look down at the group of three figures in the lower left corner of the scene. His mouth may be open perhaps suggesting he is speaking to the group at left. This may be Christ.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. In the lower left corner of the composition, three right-facing figures appear to bend forward, perhaps in gestures of supplication. The leftmost figure, who appears to be male with short hair perhaps wearing knee breeches, raises his arms horizontally with hands clasped together. He looks toward the standing gowned male figure.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. In the lower left corner of the composition, three right-facing figures appear to bend forward, perhaps in gestures of supplication. The central figure, who may be male with short hair, kneels and raises his arms at 45 degrees, palms up, fingers spread. He looks toward the standing gowned male.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. In the lower left corner of the composition, three right-facing figures appear to bend forward, perhaps in gestures of supplication. The rightmost figure, a bearded male, kneels with one leg bent forward at the knee. He raises his bent left arm with palm facing up, fingers spread. He looks toward the standing gowned male figure.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. Near the midpoint of the left edge of the composition stands a singular figure whose body faces forward but head is turned to face right. The figure's left arm is bent and wrapped around its body, where it meets its bent right arm, perhaps in an effort to carry what may be a large object, possibly a bundle of grain, visible behind the figure's right shoulder.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. In the lower right corner of the composition, two gowned female figures walk left. The figure at right has short hair and her bent left leg is visible beneath her gown. She leans or bends forward slightly. She may be carrying a bundle of grain in her arms.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. In the lower right corner of the composition, two gowned female figures walk left. The woman at left has short hair. She steps forward with her right foot, left leg bent at the knee and extended backward. She bends forward and points toward the ground with her extended left hand.

Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. A solitary figure stands with legs spread in the upper right corner of the composition with both arms raised vertically. Though indistinct, this figure appears to wear some kind of long garment, perhaps a gown.
Several groups of figures appear to labor in an agricultural (wheat?) field. In the upper half of the scene, slightly right of center, three(?) indistinct figures are visible.

In the upper left corner of the composition stand multiple structures. Though relatively indistinct in their details, these appear to include a silo at right and one, perhaps two, houses or barns at left.
Vertical lines in the foreground likely indicate stalks of the agricultural crop and horizontal lines in the background suggest additional fields in the distance.
